comments_since_last_sample.body: Hubert Parry's most notable contribution was putting William Blake's epic poem "Jerusalem" to music.
Tomaso Albinoni - Adagio in G Minor

I think a really underrated piece by an almost unknown composer would be Weinburg's 12th symphony. It was written as memorial to Shostakovich's death, as they were very good friends. The symphony as a whole has the footprint of Shostakovich, but he also uses his own style, harsher brass, more dissonance, and it's really a joy to listen to. In particular, the first and third movements are masterpieces. If anyone reads this, I encourage you to try it out, especially if you love Shostakovich.
So happy that you found Le Sapin by Sibelius! Here in Finland piano students play that very often and it’s so beautiful piece ❤️🇫🇮
The Schumann movement is one of my very favorite pieces ever!

I just adore Haydn's Piano Concerto in D major. This piece is not that underrated, but I just wanted to comment on how it's one of my faves and how I wish for everyone to hear it. Please go and check Martha Argerich's recording of it
